Just did a test to check and see if I lost an exorbant amount of money when I die as well. Results: Let skags kill me (Outside firestone) lost $300. Jumped off the cliff at the start of the new DLC, lost $300. Let enemies in the next area kill me, Lost $300. I do not seem to be getting any kind of money glitch opun my death, but I did the test with a wimpy little character, not one of my level 50+ playthrough 2/DLC characters. I'll try again with my power house characters shortly after backing up my characters...

Okay, back from my second test with a level 61 playthough 2 character. I jumped off the cliff at the start of the DLC and lost $17 million dollars... however my character still reads as having $9.99 million dollars...

So either you lost all your money because the re-spawn fee for high level characters is obscene, some thing is specifically wrong with your game or my money counter is busted...

I'll blow through playthough 1 with my Level 61 Lilith and glitch hunt. I'll be back in a couple hours.

1) Mis-encoded chinese text fucks up rtorrent because my UTF8 system expects normal characters.
2) A link to a chinese site. WHY?
3) Split-rars. This is neither ftp nor rapidshare, etc. It's a waste of people's time and disk space and is utterly redundant seeing as the bittorrent protocol chunks big files.

Thanks, good torrent.
Though I was disappointed with the DLC. You'd think killing claptraps would be fun on another level. And it kinda is, the way they often explode with shotgun shots. But after the first couple hundred, they're just the new skags. And you'll be killing a lot more than that many, especially if you take Tannis' retarded quest line which has you gathering about 300+ claptrap components - which you have to cap them for. Let me warn you to skip that because you'll most likely be unimpressed by the end of it all. It really is in Borderlands style to be goofy and one up you, but after all that hassle, I was ticked off. Unless you're up for mindless farming for experience (lol), you ought to heed my warning.
Anyways, I guess the bosses are funny to meet and I won't tell why, you'll see it when you see it. The end fight and "the end" is also amusing. Beyond that though, really, it's hogwash and unimpressive, the way this was presented, I was something much more ingenious but this didn't really innovative Borderlands the slightest.
This definitely ranks somewhere among Dr. Ned's Zombie Island for its lack of vehicles. Knoxx's Armory was the best DLC because of the highways and vehicles, the most fun for me in that one was really the bumper cars experience when playing with 3 other fellas, even if they were random joiners. Really got a few chuckles out of me. Plus there's Scooter.
So if you're getting the game and all DLCs in one go just now, I recommend the original campaign and this DLC, and pass the rest. And preferably steer clear of side missions, they're almost always garbage content, no matter the game.
